Class Validator

  • java.lang.Object
    • Validator

  • public class Validator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains methods for validating user input from forms throughout the system. Methods return a boolean value depending on the validity of the input.
    Author:
    Matthew Brookes

    • Field Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Validator(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
      The constructor requires a JFrame as an input so error messages can be drawn directly to make them relevant to a specific error

    • Constructor Detail

      • Validator

        public Validator(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        The constructor requires a JFrame as an input so error messages can be drawn directly to make them relevant to a specific error
        Parameters:
        frame - The current window

    • Method Detail

      • isValidName

        public boolean isValidName(java.lang.String name)
        This method returns true if the name passed is valid i.e. contains only alpha characters and is less than 41 characters.
        Parameters:
        name - The full name of the scout
        Returns:
        boolean True if name is valid else returns false

      • isValidEmail

        public boolean isValidEmail(java.lang.String email)
        This method returns true if the email address is valid i.e. follows the pattern abc@def.ghi and is less than 40 characters.
        Parameters:
        email - The contact email address of the scout
        Returns:
        boolean True if email address is valid else returns false

      • isValidPhone

        public boolean isValidPhone(java.lang.String phone)
        This method returns true if the phone number is valid i.e. is a sequence of 11 digits.
        Parameters:
        phone - The contact phone number of the scout
        Returns:
        boolean True if phone number is valid else returns false

      • isValidDate

        public boolean isValidDate(java.lang.String date)
        This method returns true if the date passed is valid i.e. it follows the format DD/MM/YYYY
        Parameters:
        date - The date to be validated
        Returns:
        boolean True if date is valid else returns false

      • isValidAddress

        public boolean isValidAddress(java.lang.String addr)
        This method returns true if the address line is valid i.e. it contains less than 41 characters and is alphanumeric
        Parameters:
        addr - The line to be validated
        Returns:
        boolean True if the line is valid else returns false

      • isValidCompulsoryAddress

        public boolean isValidCompulsoryAddress(java.lang.String addr)
        This method returns true if the address line is valid i.e. it must be filled and satisfy the validation requirements for a normal address
        Parameters:
        addr - The line to be validated
        Returns:
        boolean True if the line is valid else returns false
